It's so refreshing to find a place on Polk where you can listen to great music while still hearing yourself talk, all while enjoying great wines for a reasonable price.   They are very generous with their pours and let you try anything before ordering a glass. The owner, Liam, was funny, engaging and so appreciative of his clients and the bartenders were attentive and very friendly. There was no pretentiousness like you find at so many other wine bars and we felt like we were really taken care of there.  They do close around midnight, so it's not a great late night place, but it's the perfect spot for a mellow evening with friends or a date. This is definitely a gem in Russian Hill and I will be coming back often.

--5MV_3EqmQinXwJPNI2fg.review_text: Have been here twice. We really like the cozy vibe and welcome feeling we get when there. It's a wine bar and have only had the wine and a cheese plate. I had a Cabernet Sauvignon first time and a red wine flight on the second visit. Service is generally friendly, sometimes a bit slow but always friendly.  They have a small area in the back where performers play on occasion.  High point: good prices and good wine and cheese Low point: sometimes slow service. Chances we will go back ? Yes and already have. I can see this becoming a regular place for us.

1q0A8PTLysxWdnbJF5GThw.review_text: We had the owner help us with wine selections! He was great and funny. Made our experience here at The Pour House worth it!! We will be back. Thank you Liam!!

ZW31ZqLp_y_LbV7wSwNhag.review_text: The Pour House is a lovely place to have a date and/or a hangout. My friends and I frequented this place on Memorial Day, in of which, it was one of the few wine bars on Polk street that were open and until midnight.   The girl working provided excellent service. She was attentive and quick and allowed my friends and I a couple tastes before buying a bottle to share. The wine selection could have been more extensive; however, we were satisfied with what we had. We also had an additional glass of their sparkling wine and Rose, which were both crisp and refreshing. Additionally, the atmosphere was great but maybe because it was a Monday night. They did have live music for a little while, which added to the relaxed atmosphere.   Overall, my friends and I had an enjoyable experience and appreciated the good service. I would definitely come back here again!

hSj4YSD8GyYQ_sMmiNGJng.review_text: Mellow atmosphere, decent selection of wine and small eats. Bartender working tonight has tried all the wines and offered her take on the wines. Every wine tried was excellent. Happily gave me tastes if I was unsure. Prices seems about right for the location and selection.  I will definitely return.

2FBhsogD9wrTk_7g6rf-6Q.review_text: Short but tasty selection of wines (both red and white varieties). Large pours.     On-hand delivery menus compensating for limited cheese and cracker offering; next level wine-bar maneuver.    Comfortable atmosphere of soft easy listening music from Tom Petty to the Postal Service that allows easy conversation.   Very friendly bartender on my first visit who allowed a friend's dog to soak in the ambiance.  Not sure if this is standard.

FaaZlPb9Yk70uU-ElILDQA.review_text: This place has become the official/unofficial meeting for my Sex-and-the-City-esque group of single SF city girlfriends (I think I'm the Charlotte of the group).  We always order the flights and sometimes we customize them to our liking.  They have a great selection of wines and great atmosphere and I recently discovered you can order Thai food and have it delivered from across the street.  It comes over quickly and it's pretty yummy.  We've had cheese plates at Pour House and those are good too.  Also, it's a great escape from the post-college crowd on Polk, a godsend when you are in this neighborhood and happen to be in the 30-and-Up Club.

qD7BCSxI74WxmLmEHnwNPw.review_text: Place is way more chill than anywhere else on Polk.  Syrah was tasty.  Accidentally left my laptop there and they took care of it overnight.  Pretty awesome right?  Highly recommend...

RSLRo5XvR3uN3_Uqfc9geQ.review_text: The wine is list is extremly unimpressive. I had a hard time selecting domething interesting. The flights seem thrown together based on what yhey r trying to get rid of. The bartender was not knowledgeable at all and didn't know anything about the wine he was pouring. There are cases of wine stacked on the bookcase shelves screaming, "buy me, the owners got me at bulk discount and arnt afraid to show it". The space itself is cute and intimate so its really too bad. The olives were old or something. I will not be back

YrbtycnG1D12-O3rWyk8qA.review_text: This is a great neighborhood wine bar.  It isn't pretentious and over-run by a bunch of wannabe wine snobs.  They have a nice selection, the bartenders are great and if you get hungry you can order Thai food from next door!  Go here if you want low key, ambiance, yummy wine and Thai food! :-)

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: For a wine bar, there isn't much of a wine selection. Maybe I've just been going to really extensive wine bars, but I was not that impressed with what they had to offer.   A friend and I wandered in on a Saturday night after reading a couple Yelp reviews and, not going to lie, the White Town blasting sort of drew us in. It wasn't very packed and we sat at the bar. 20 minutes or so later this wave of people came in. Mixed bag of folks. I didn't care for the bartender's attitude. He wasn't the friendliest.   Yeah, this place just didn't do it for me. Sorry guys.

en7bEkzUtMBcZBGrADW3Xg.review_text: Love love love the pour house! A great addition to my neighborhood.  I've been here plenty of times and what I love most about this is that the crowd can always very from trendy hipsters, art students, business folk, and the casual passerby. And everyone is treated with the same exact attention.  I came here for a birthday the first time I came and we sat in the big table in the back. Won't lie- a few of us were intrigued by the big ladder by the bar and tried our best not to climb up!   Service is always great, with very generous pours. The interiors have a very warm, comforting feel, without the fancy window dressings.   If you don't think you can afford Amelie, a few blocks up post, this place is a great substitute and I can pronounce half the list (never was too good at french).   Try it out! It's never been too crowded. Loves it

PJhX_wdn6CTWuPS5jhqsTQ.review_text: This just became my new favorite wine bar!  Their selections of wines are incredible and it is fabulous that they are willing to let you try a wine before you order it.  Ryan, the bartender, was the only one working last night but I never felt neglected.  He was always right there when my glass was empty to offer me another glass.  This is a great place to go with friends and especially friends who are not necessarily wine people but prefer beer as they have a bunch of beers on tap and in a bottle.  The other great thing is you can bring food into the bar from local restaurants, I highly recommend the shawarma from Frisco's Pizza and Shawarma.   Pour house does have some cheese plates available to order but I got the kalamata olives, which were absolutely delicious!  Ended up spending over 4 hours there and never felt rushed.  Total bill with four people, more than a dozen glasses of wine and more than 10 beers came to $91, pretty dang impressive!  Will most certainly be returning!
